item.title: AMC 8 Test | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: Are you excited about the AMC 8 but find that your school doesn't host the contest? No problem! You can sign up and take the test at Blue Ridge Boost. We offer a welcoming space for young math enthusiasts to test their skills and enjoy a rewarding competition experience. The AMC 8 is a 25-question, 40-minute competition designed for students in grade 8 and below. The competition focuses on middle school mathematics topics, including counting and probability, estimation, proportional reasoning, elementary geometry (including the Pythagorean Theorem), spatial visualization, and interpreting graphs and tables.

item.title: Python Fundamentals | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: This course is a comprehensive, year-long program designed for middle school students with no prior coding experience. It introduces fundamental programming concepts using Python through interactive exercises and projects centered around controlling a virtual character named Tracy. The course covers commands, functions, loops, variables, conditionals, and lists, progressing to more complex tasks like user interaction and creating visual projects. Topics include: Commands Understanding basic commands is crucial as it forms the foundation of programming, allowing Tracy to perform specific actions.

item.title: Problem Solving | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: This class equips students with essential problem-solving strategies that are invaluable for tackling advanced math topics and excelling in competitive math contests such as Math Olympiad, Kangaroo Math, and AMC 8. Through engaging lessons and practice problems, students will develop critical thinking skills and a deeper understanding of mathematical concepts, preparing them for success in both competition and classroom settings.

item.title: Chess Tactics and Games | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: We are excited to start a chess program for our more dedicated players, who are ready to learn more about the game and improve their skills. The classes start at 10 am with a 45 minutes lesson, followed by three 15-minute games. The pickup time is 12:00. The classes are held at Blue Ridge Boost and are taught by Daniel Wurtzer. Hello my name is Daniel Wurzer and I am excited to teach chess lessons at Blue Ridge Boost this fall.

item.title: Advanced Python for Tweens | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: Through interactive challenges, students help twin baby monkeys reunite by solving coding problems, reinforcing their understanding of Python fundamentals and advanced topics. The course covers essential concepts such as sequencing, loops, conditionals, and functions. Course Content Basics review Classes: Understanding object-oriented programming to create and manage complex data structures.Input: Interacting with users by receiving and processing input data.String manipulation: Performing operations on text data to modify and analyze it.Advanced data types: Utilizing complex data structures like dictionaries and sets for efficient data management.

item.title: First Lego Challenge | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: Prepare to take on the challenges of FIRST LEGO League like a pro! This course is designed to help students build a strong foundation in robotics and engineering, focusing on the key skills needed to design, build, and optimize a competition-ready robot. Students will: Master the fundamentals of building sturdy and efficient robots tailored for competition. Learn how to design and attach modular attachments that can be quickly changed to tackle a variety of missions.

item.title: Robotics with Vex IQ | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: Description: Join us at Blue Ridge Boost for an exciting, hands-on journey into coding and computational thinking with the VEX IQ (2nd Generation) robotics platform! Using the structured curriculum from the Carnegie Mellon Robotics Academy, this class introduces students to the fundamentals of robotics programming, problem-solving, and real-world applications. Designed for beginners and enthusiasts, the course features engaging, project-based activities that teach students to build, program, and control their robots using the VEXcode programming software.

item.title: Unity 2D Games | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: Explore the exciting world of game design and programming with Unity! These beginner-friendly courses are designed to teach students the fundamentals of game development while building fun and interactive projects. With hands-on lessons and real-world applications, students will learn to create their own games and bring their ideas to life using Unity's powerful tools. Unit 1: 2D Beginner: Adventure GameStep into the world of 2D game development by creating an adventure game from scratch!

item.title: Machine Learning for Kids | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: Dive into the fascinating world of artificial intelligence with this hands-on class designed for young learners! Using the Machine Learning for Kids platform, students will explore how machines can "learn" from data and apply this knowledge to solve real-world problems in creative ways. This class introduces the basics of machine learning through fun, interactive projects, where students will: Learn how to train machine learning models using simple datasets. Explore key concepts like classification, recognition, and prediction.

item.title: Math Boost | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: This class is tailored for students who are in the top half of the class, but need clarifications of some grade-level concepts. It offers reinforcement of key concepts through extra practice with typical grade-level problems, ensuring that students can grasp and master the material at their own pace. Additionally, students will have the opportunity to work on materials recommended by their classroom teacher and tackle problems suggested by Blue Ridge Boost instructors, providing a tailored and comprehensive approach to meet their individual learning needs.

item.title: Python and Legos | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: Python coding in the morning and Lego Robotics in the afternoon.

item.title: Python for Tweens | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: Embark on an exciting journey into the world of programming with Python! This class is designed to make coding fun, engaging, and accessible for kids as they explore the basics of Python through creative and interactive projects. Students will dive into programming concepts while solving puzzles, building games, and experimenting with whimsical projects featuring monsters, secret agents, and more! Throughout the class, students will: Learn foundational programming concepts like loops and conditionals.
